sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you want to buy a <radical>geoduck</radical> you have to go to the bank <radical>beforehand</radical> to <kanji>deposit</kanji> enough money. If you don't deposit your money you won't have enough in your account to buy even one! They're expensive, after all.
meaningInfo: Imagine yourself depositing your money beforehand. Imagine the delicious geoduck you'll be able to buy now that the money has been deposited into your account!
readingMnemonic: You go to the bank to make the <kanji>deposit</kanji> and there is a kid standing in your way playing with a <reading>yo</reading>-yo (<ja>よ</ja>). You try to squeeze past and he hits you in the face with the yo-yo! Now you can't see! Now you can't make the deposit!
readingInfo: Imagine trying to make a deposit to your bank after getting hit in the face with a yo-yo. You can hardly see what you're shoving your money into. You hope it isn't the hands of the kid that hit you!
